content.rendered:
This Thursday September 22nd and Saturday September 24th Nature Theater of Oklahoma’s Life and Times returns to New York City — part of FIAF’s Crossing the Line Festival.

On September 22nd, see Episode 8 at FIAF Florence Gould Hall, 55 East 59th Street, followed by opening night party for the festival.

And on September 24th, watch all Episodes 7-9 in one evening, starting at 5pm at Anthology Film Archives.

For further details on these events, visit the Crossing the Line website.

excerpt.rendered: This Thursday September 22nd and Saturday September 24th Nature Theater of Oklahoma’s Life and Times returns to New York City — part of FIAF’s Crossing the Line Festival. On September 22nd, see Episode 8 at FIAF Florence Gould Hall, 55 East 59th Street, followed by opening night party for the festival. And on September 24th, watch […]

content.rendered:
The Battle for Burgundy on a field in Rimbach.

Late in the fall of 2013 Nature Theater of Oklahoma embarked on a project with the festival Matchbox in the Rhine-Neckar region of Germany which we called the Nibelungen Cycle.  Over the course of 2014 we visited this region, made connections with people in ten towns, wrote our own version of the Nibelungen saga (set in this region) and cast it from an acting pool of its citizens and locals. Then, in fall of 2014, we set off with a movie camera and a core cast of 8 on bicycle to various locations where we staged and shot a film over the course of 3 intense weeks, working with local artists, clubs, church groups, choirs, fire departments, historical re-enactors, office workers, sailors, dogs, and farm animals.  Our script called for a dragon, a Viking ship, a storm at sea, a treasure, a magic cloak which makes people disappear, a trained German sheppard, a state funeral, a double wedding… we were not sure what we would get.  We were surprised every step of the way…

We will be screening the final edited finished film version of these site-specific performances — made over the course of the past two years —for one night only: this coming Friday September 9th in Mannheim at the National Theater. This will be the film’s official premiere and the first chance the participants have had to see the film they helped to create on the big screen.

We are happy to be able to share with you this special event which represents a new turn in our work.

Full details and ticket info are available on the Matchbox festival website.

There is also a trailer for the film here.

And more coming up: September 22-24 we have the NYC premiere of Life and Times – Episodes 7-9 as part of Crossing the Line Festival.

content.rendered:
In just one week Nature Theater of Oklahoma will be in Cologne to start their next project, a live performance Sci-Fi film project, Germany 2071. Cast with local participants in Cologne and Berlin and shot on location in these two cities — the work (and fun) officially starts June 16th and continues until July 16th in collaboration with Impulse Festival (Cologne) and Foreign Affairs Festival (Berlin).  For more details (and to learn how you join us in this quest!) visit germany2071.de

And coming September 9th – be sure not to miss the world premiere of Die Nibelungen, a silent film project which we made last summer working also with some amazing local people in the beautiful Odenwald region of Germany. The finished film, made in collaboration with Matchbox Rhein-Neckar, will premiere this fall  at Schauspiel des Nationaltheaters Mannheim on September 9th. For further info, follow this link!

title.rendered: Coming Attractions: Life and Times – Episodes 7-9!

content.rendered: Yes, coming this fall to a theater (hopefully) near you: it’s Life and Times – Episodes 7-9!  Upcoming dates include: steirischer herbst festival in Graz, Austria, Hebbel Theater (HAU 1) in Berlin, Bard College Fischer Center for the Performing Arts, and Théâtre de la Cité in Paris (Episode 8 only).  Follow the links for further details and our video trailer!

title.rendered: The Great Nature Theater of Oklahoma is Calling You!

content.rendered: This Friday May 15th at 7:30pm Anthology Film Archives will be screening our film, The Great Nature Theater of Oklahoma is Calling You! — part of their series: Downtown New York Theater – Behind the Scenes — also featuring the work of Elevator Repair Service and The Wooster Group.  The movie was made during an intense month in residence working at the Hebbel HAU 1 Theater in Berlin in the summer of 2013, and will be screened for one night only.  Don’t miss it!

content.rendered:
Tonight is the last night to catch our Midnight Moment in Times Square — and if you missed the festivities — you can check out the video of the Midnight Snack in Times Square on Sept. 20th, here.

photograph by Ka-Man Tse for @TSqArts. Midnight Moment: Nature Theater of Oklahoma, Life and Times – Episode 4.5. September 1 – 30, 2013; 11:57pm – midnight every night. Midnight Moment is a presentation of the Times Square Advertising Coalition (TSAC) and Times Square Arts. This month’s program presented in partnership with Crossing the Line, the French Institute Alliance Française (FIAF).

title.rendered: Life and Times Episode 4.5 has its Midnight Moment

content.rendered:
Midnight Moment: Nature Theater of Oklahoma, Life and Times – Episode 4.5.
September 1 – 30, 2013; 11:57pm – midnight every night.
photograph by Ka-Man Tse for @TSqArts.

Every night in September at 11:57, you can see part of the animated movie that is Life and Times – Episode 4.5 playing on 15 jumbotrons all over Times Square!  For more details click here.  Midnight Moment is a presentation of the Times Square Advertising Coalition (TSAC) and Times Square Arts.  This month’s program presented in partnership with Crossing the Line, the French Institute Alliance Française (FIAF).

title.rendered: Nature Theater of Oklahoma is calling YOU!

content.rendered: Join us in Berlin starting June 28th for BBQ, performances of Romeo and Juliet, Life and Times Episodes 1 – 5, and much much more!  For details go to: berlinerfestspiele.de and hebbel-am-ufer.de

title.rendered: OK Theater is coming to Sweden and the UK

content.rendered: We’re packing our bags for upcoming performances of Life and Times at Göteborgs Dans & Teater Festival and Norfolk and Norwich Festival – where we officially premiere our next installment – Episodes 4.5 & 5.  Hope to see you there!  Follow links for further details.

title.rendered: Nature Theater comes to Göteborgs Dans & Teater Festival

content.rendered:
Life and Times Episodes 1 – 4 will be at Göteborgs Dans & Teater Festival May 16th, 2013

This video was shot by Pavol Liska and edited by Ilan Bachrach.  Featuring Nature Theater of Oklahoma Burgermeisters: Gabel Eiben, Ilan Bachrach, Nora Hertlein, Matt Korahais, and Kristin Worrall

title.rendered: Nature Theater visits WNYC – March 3rd at 8pm

content.rendered: Tune in March 3rd  at 8pm to Spinning on Air on WNYC.  We will be talking with host David Garland about Life and Times and singing selections from Episode 1 in studio.  The broadcast will also be available on the web with video.  Check at http://www.wnyc.org/shows/spinning
